snippet.title: Mutation limits Alzheimer's disease, other cognitive decline
snippet.description: ...Most people who live long enough undergo a gradual decline in their mental abilities. For those who suffer from Alzheimer's disease, however, the decline is radical; in some genetic forms of the disease, it can even strike middle-aged victims. This has led many to conclude that Alzheimer's pathology is distinct from that of age-related decline. But a new study has found a single mutatio...
